result.execSummary:
The defendant Anne M. Simon #226866 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.08(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and surcharge unless one has previously been provided.  Undergo any counseling/treatment/AODA/evaluations per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

charges.descr: Homicide by Negligent Handling of Dangerous Weapon/Explosive

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anne M. Simon in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances and status.  Amended information filed today and agreement is stated.  Atty Mastantuono is in agreement/acknowledges rec. amended information, waives reading and pleads guilty.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE agrees to plead Guilty.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  VIS provided to parties and reviewed.  State explains basis for recommendations.  Atty Mastantuono makes statement on behalf of DE/notes withdrawal of previously filed motion.  State makes further statements.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  Guilty
10 years prison (5 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision)
To commence FORTHWITH
440 days sentence credit to be applied
Conditions of extended supervision:
Costs of $518.00 to be paid per agent
DNA sample to be provided unless one has previously been provided
AODA/counseling/treatment/evaluations all per agent
Not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP
response brief in support of DE's motion to suppress statements & physical evidence
fax'd Cover Letter from atty. Mastantuono
Defendant's brief in support of defendant's motion to suppress statements
fax'd Cover Letter from atty. Mastantuono
Supporting State's Motion to Admit Statements

Defendant Anne M. Simon in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono and Rebecca Coffey.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in custody.  Kevin Calkins and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer to be Justin Hannegan, Sauk County Detective.  Motion hearing scheduled for this morning.  State calls Deputy Billie Mears, sworn & testifies.  Sauk County Deputy.  Testifies to incident date.  Attorney Mastantuono moves for sequestration.  State advises of no other witnesses present that will be testifying today.  Attorney Mastantuono cross examines Deputy Mears regarding incident.  State redirect.  Deputy Mears released from motion hearing.  State calls Srgt. Jon Hanson, sworn & testifies.  Sauk County Srgt.  Atty. Mastantuono cross exam witness.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Srgt. Hanson released from motion hearing.  Atty. Calkins calls Cpt. Mike Stoddard, SCSD, sworn & testifies. Atty. Mastantuono cross exam.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Atty. Mastantuono objects, sustained as to if DE knew being recorded.  Cpt. Stoddard released from motion hearing.  Atty. Calkins calls Sgt. Eric Miller, SCSD, sworn in & testifies.  Atty. Mastantuono objects to determine arrest, overruled. Atty. M. cross exam.  Atty. Calkins redirect.  Atty. M. recross. Recess.  Back on record 10:33.  Atty. Calkins calls detective Drew Bulin, SCSD, sworn in & testifies. Marked exhibit 1 & 2, recv'd.  Atty. Mastantuono cross exam.  Witness excused for motion hearing.  Atty. Calkins calls detective Justin Hannagan, SCSD, sworn in & testifies.  Marked exhibit 3 & 4, recv'd.  Atty. Mastantuono cross exam. Atty. Calkins redirect.  Witness excused for motion hearing.  30 days for submission of transcript of hearing and then set for status or briefing.   End of Aug. 31 for simanteous brief, 10 days for reply by Sept. 11th.  Decision after that.
Motion hearing on June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Atty Coffee acknowledges rec. information/waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters not guilty plea.  Parties address doing a motion hearing next and setting a date for that.  Court gives the defense 4/17/2015 to file any motions and then sets hearing date.  Bond continued.

Defendant Anne M. Simon in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono and Attorney Rebecca Coffee.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in custody.  Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Court Officer Justin Hannagan - SCSD.  Court states case and State states appearances.  State calls Det. Justin Hannagan - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  State continues direct.  Atty Coffee does cross-exam.  Witness excused.  State has nothing further and no defense witnesses.  Court finds probable cause and binds her over for trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anne M. Simon in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter not resolved.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on January 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Return date on January 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Anne M. Simon by video from LEC with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State requests cash bond.  Atty Sacra responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $40,000.00 cash bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
